SEARCH
Package io.papermc.paper.plugin.lifecycle.event.types

Class LifecycleEvents

java.lang.Object
io.papermc.paper.plugin.lifecycle.event.types.LifecycleEvents
public final class LifecycleEvents extends Object
Holds various types of lifecycle events for use when creating event handler configurations in LifecycleEventManager.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final LifecycleEventType.Prioritizable<LifecycleEventOwner,ReloadableRegistrarEvent<Commands>>
    COMMANDS
    This event is for registering commands to the server's brigadier command system.
    static final LifecycleEventType.Prioritizable<BootstrapContext,RegistrarEvent<DatapackRegistrar>>
    DATAPACK_DISCOVERY
    This event is for informing the server about any available datapacks from other sources such as inside a plugin's jar.
    static final TagEventTypeProvider
    TAGS
    These events are for registering tags to the server's tag system.

  • Method Summary

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • COMMANDS

      public static final LifecycleEventType.Prioritizable<LifecycleEventOwner,ReloadableRegistrarEvent<Commands>> COMMANDS
      This event is for registering commands to the server's brigadier command system. You can register a handler for this event in JavaPlugin.onEnable() or PluginBootstrap.bootstrap(BootstrapContext).
      See Also:
      • an example of a command being registered

    • TAGS

      @Experimental public static final TagEventTypeProvider TAGS
      These events are for registering tags to the server's tag system. You can register a handler for these events only in PluginBootstrap.bootstrap(BootstrapContext).

    • DATAPACK_DISCOVERY

      @Experimental public static final LifecycleEventType.Prioritizable<BootstrapContext,RegistrarEvent<DatapackRegistrar>> DATAPACK_DISCOVERY
      This event is for informing the server about any available datapacks from other sources such as inside a plugin's jar. You can register a handler for this event only in PluginBootstrap.bootstrap(BootstrapContext).
      See Also:
      • an example of a datapack being discovered
